results.title: This is your museum speaking
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Verrall and Lynn Smith
results.brief_description: This short animated film tells the story of a night watchman who, with his dog, Fang, discovers that museums are not morgues, that they are very much a part of the community. With humor, the film shows how our present is connected to the past.

results.title: This is your lung
results.creator_credit: Verity Films, Film Producers Guild and Oswald Skilbeck
results.brief_description: Designed to discourage cigarette smoking. Uses a smoking machine to show a variety of foreign matter in cigarette smoke, including a cancer-causing tar. Deals with a patient who has a smoker’s cough, but is ultimately found to be suffering from lung cancer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Verity Films, Film Producers Guild and Oswald Skilbeck

results.title: This is working
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee, Elisabeth Knight and Keith Gow
results.brief_description: Aboriginal people suffer an unemployment rate six times higher than the white community. Shows Aboriginal people in New South Wales who are working on four different job creation projects. Features, amongst others, Bill Powell, Aboriginal Liaison Officer TAFE, Rose Kirby, Murrin Bridge Handcraft Industries, Des Simon, apprentice carpenter, Purfleet and Dallas Carberry, park management trainee, Orient Point.

results.title: This is Victoria: Australia
results.brief_description: Silent footage of parts of Victoria and its people from the 1950s produced to promote Victoria. “The Rip” is the first sequence lasting approximately three minutes, where a family park the car to take in the view. They watch large cargo ships traverse the narrow entrance to Port Phillip Bay known as The Rip. Point Lonsdale is shown - the main street (full of fabulous cars from the era) and the lighthouse. Family beach fun is shown as children play in the shallows, people sunbake or rest in the shade of an umbrella, knit, go camping, wash baby in a big plastic tub, walk over the dunes, go surfing or play ballgames. “The Rose Chapel of St Helena” is a sequence approximately two minutes long about a small church in the Eltham/Greensborough area but before getting to that area there are a couple of shots of the City of Melbourne. The Chapel is shown, as are the gravestones from the 1850s that surround the chapel of this small Church of England. Some patrons and a clergyman are also in attendance. “Yarra Bridges” is the final sequence lasting about three minutes and it has some wonderful views of Melbourne and the Bridges that cross the Yarra River. St Pauls Cathedral over Princes Bridge, a view of the Governor’s Residence, cars, trains and assorted automobiles, a white helmeted policeman directing traffic, construction of pillars for a new bridge, the swing bridge at Yarra Bend and a Yarra River Boat Cruise are all shown.

results.title: This is Ulster
results.creator_credit: R.H.R. Productions, Ronald H. Riley and Richard F. Tambling
results.brief_description: A panorama of Ulster, the northern province of Ireland which forms part of the United Kingdom. Some of the country’s physical characteristics, which bear their own special brand of beauty, form the background to a survey of industrial and rural life. No reference to the simmering poitical issues.

results.title: This is TVA
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the Tennessee Valley from its original state through the period when by bad farming the land was ruined to its present highly industrialised condition. The change has been brought about by the Tennessee Valley Authority, a Federal body with the power to build dams on the rivers in seven states. The rivers are now navigable at all seasons, hydro-electric power is available over large areas and there are chemical industries producing fertilisers and other agricultural products. The TVA has made possible these industries and brought huge areas back into production at a much higher level than formally.

results.title: This is Tokyo
results.brief_description: A survey of Tokyo showing the business and industrial centres, historic buildings like the Imperial Palace and Buddhist temples, the landscape gardens and the people who live and work in this huge city.
